properties.headline: Sydney Royal Easter Show - Thursday 1 to Monday 12 April - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd
properties.publicTransport: Express trains and Major Event Buses are running daily during - tap on & off using an Opal card or contactless payment as travel is not included in tickets to the Show. Buses in the precinct are diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show at Sydney Olympic Park each day from Thursday 1 April until Monday 12 April. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the precinct throughout the show, particularly over the Easter Long Weekend. 

Attendees driving to the event should plan to arrive early and pre-book parking online in advance as parking will be in high demand.

PARKING UPDATE: all pre-booked parking for Saturday 3, Sunday 4 and Monday 5 April has sold out - if you haven't pre-booked consider other parking and travel options. Show tickets are also sold out for Saturday 3 and Sunday 4 April. 

Roads in the precinct are closed for the duration of the Show until 6am Tuesday 13 April including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr and Shane Gould Ave. Other roads in the precinct will remain closed until 20 April to allow for the removal of event infrastructure.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads within the Sydney Olympic Park precinct will be closed prior to the Show to allow for even infrastructure set up. Additional roads will close during the Show for crow safety and will remain closed until after the Show for event pack down.

FROM 1AM TUESDAY 16 MARCH TO APPROX. 10AM TUESDAY 20 APRIL 2021

  • Olympic Boulevard 100m north of Dawn Fraser Avenue adjacent to the Cathy Freeman Park amenities to 200m south of Edwin Flack Ave outside Qudos Bank Arena

FROM 12:01AM THURSDAY 18 MARCH TO 10AM TUESDAY 20 APRIL 2021

  • Australia Avenue from Murray Rose Avenue to Kevin Coombs Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Grand Parade
  • Grand Parade from Olympic Boulevard to Australia Avenue

FROM 2AM THURSDAY 1 APRIL TO 6AM TUESDAY 13 APRIL 2021

  • Kevin Coombs Avenue from Australia Avenue to Pondage Link
  • Marjorie Jackson Parkway from Wentworth Common Carpark to Australia Ave
  • Olympic Boulevard from Kevin Coombs to Sarah Durack Avenue
  • Showground Road from Murray Rose Avenue to Dawn Fraser Avenue
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Showground Road to Gate 15 (fixed closure) & Park Street
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Edwin Flack Avenue to Showground Road (Accessible drop off / pick up & Show drop off / pick up â€“ Edwin Flack Avenue to Fig Grove)
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Rod Laver Drive to Olympic Boulevard
  • Shirley Strickland Ave from Olympic Boulevard to the M4 Exit (P4 car park)
  • Rod Laver Drive from Shirley Strickland to the Tennis Centre
  • Shane Gould Avenue at P2 Car Park

properties.headline: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading  - Friday 2 to Monday 5 April - PYRMONT Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Bridge Rd approaching Sydney Fish Markets
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market will operate extended trading hours on Good Friday, 2 April from 5am to 5pm and regular trading hours for the remainder of the weekend until Monday.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area.

Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in very high demand.

Limited parking is available at the main Sydney Fish Market car park entry via Bank St. Additional parking will be available on Good Friday at the Sydney Secondary College on Pyrmont Bridge Rd.
properties.displayName: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading  - Friday 2 to Monday 5 April

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Family Show is taking place at The Entertainment Quarter from Thursday 1 to Sunday 18 April from 10am to 5pm each day.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from The Sydney Family Show each day. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian movement.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Warriors at the SCG from 6:15pm to approx 8:15pm

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on roads around the Moore Park precinct as footy fans travel to the SCG on Easter Sunday. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4:15pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: NewRun - Sunday 11 April - NEWCASTLE Wharf Rd, Shortland Esplanade & Memorial Drive to Bar Beach
properties.publicTransport: Route 21 buses will be affected. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Runners will participate in a marathon, half marathon, 5km or 2km events in the annual NewRun - Newcastle Running Festival starting from 6am at Queens Wharf travelling around the foreshore to finish back at Market St Lawn. The Hill to Harbour 10km run will start from Bar Beach at 8.30am also finishing at Market St Lawn.

Road Closures will be in place between 5am and 11:30am on sections of roads around the event course. 

  • 5am to 11.30am - Wharf Rd from Watt St to Argyle St
  • 5.30am to 11.30am - Wharf Rd from Watt St to Nobbys Rd
  • 5am to 11.30am - Shortland Espl from Zaara St to Nobbys Rd
  • 5.30am to 9.15am - Memorial Dr from Bar Beach Ave to Kilgour Ave

Traffic is expected to be heavy between 5am and 10am as participants arrive and between 1pm and 3pm as they leave the area. 

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time while in the area and to follow the direction of traffic controllers.

roads.mainStreet: Wharf Rd, Shortland Esplanade & Memorial Drive

properties.headline: Anzac Day Service and March - Sunday 18 April - MASCOT Botany Road between King Street AND Coward Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays through Mascot while closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info for service disruption information.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Anzac Day Mascot 2021 - closure and clearway map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Anzac Day Mascot 2021 - closure and clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
Anzac Day commemorations will be held at Mascot on Sunday 18 April. The march will start from King St at 2:15pm, finishing at Mascot Memorial Park by 2:45pm.

The northbound lanes of Botany Rd will be closed from King St to Coward St from 2:15pm until approximately 2:45pm while the march is underway. Sections of Coward St, King St, Forster St, MacIntosh St will also be closed at Botany Rd during this time. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 12:30pm to 4pm on the western side of Botany Rd from King St to Coward St and on sections of Coward St and King St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

MASCOT

FROM 2:15PM TO 2:45PM APPROXIMATELY

  • Botany Road between King Street and Coward Street (northbound lanes)
  • Coward Street Between Henry Kendall Crescent (Eastern Side) and Botany Road
  • King Street Library Carpark (230 King Street) and Botany Road
  • Forster Street at Botany Road
  • MacIntosh Street at Botany Road

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location. 

MASCOT 

FROM 12:30PM TO 4PM

  • Botany Road between King Street and Coward Street (western side)
  • Coward Street between Botany Road and Henry Kendall Crescent (both sides)
  • King Street between Botany Road and 230 King Street (both sides)

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

  • From 3pm to 7pm: High St between the entry to the racecourse and Anzac Pde (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
Anzac Day NRL: Roosters v Dragons at the SCG from 4:05pm to approx 6pm

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on roads around the Moore Park precinct as footy fans travel to the Anzac Day game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 1pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm to 7pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Super Rugby: Waratahs v Brumbies at the SCG from 7:45pm to approx 9:20pm

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on roads around the Moore Park precinct as Super Rugby fans travel to the SCG on Good Friday. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:25pm and will reopen when crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Lang Rd, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: NRL - Friday 2 April - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Stadium Australia
properties.publicTransport: Express trains and Major Event Buses are running - use your Opal card. Buses in the precinct are diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Rabbitohs at Stadium Australia, Olympic Park from 4:05pm until 6pm approx.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd approaching the area as traffic will be heavy with Easter Show crowds also travelling to the precinct.

UPDATE: Pre-booked parking for Good Friday 2 April is sold out - if you haven't pre-booked a space consider other parking and travel options.

Roads in the precinct are closed for the Easter Show until 6am Tuesday 13 April including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr and Shane Gould Ave.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road
